intro: Keetia bakossiorum, commonly known as the Bakossi keetia, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
